Description: Hemispherical bowl and flat lid engraved with arabesques and inlaid with silver wire to form interlace and cartouches. Lid probably from another vessel. Made of brass, inlaid with silver. Signed by Mahmoud al-Kurdi
Curator's comments: On the origin of this type of metalware: D. Behrens-Abouseif, "Veneto-Saracenic Metalware, a Mamluk Art", Mamluk Studies Review 9 (2005) 147-172.
Bibliographic references: Auld 2004 / Renaissance Venice, Islam and Mahmud the Kurd - a metalworking enigma (pp.147-148)
La Niece, Ward et al 1995 / Veneto-Saracenic metalwork: an analysis of the bowls and incense burners in the British Museum
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2018 - 2019 8 Jun - 20 Jan, Ottawa, Canadian Museum of History, Medieval Europe 2017 Jul – Oct, Spain, CaixaForum Zaragoza, Medieval Europe. 2017 Mar – Jun, Spain, CaixaForum Barcelona, Medieval Europe, 2016 Oct – 2017 Feb, Spain, CaixaForum Madrid, Medieval Europe, 2015 - 2016 11 Dec- 10 Apr, Australia, Brisbane, Queensland Museum, Medieval Europe, power and legacy.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
